result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Zavon Q Luckett in court with attorney Pamela L. Popken.  Defendant Zavon Q Luckett in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.  Transcript filed 9-30-2015/lkh.

Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Ct 1: 961.341(1m)(cm)1r: Possess w/intent-Cocaine; Ct 2: 961.41(3g)(e): PCS/THC; CT 3: 961.573(1)-PDP. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Zavon Q Luckett in court with attorney Pamela L. Popken.  Defendant Zavon Q Luckett in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for Rebecca Sommers for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is asking for bonds to be converted to $1000.00 cash total as well as a co-signature bond with deft's fiancee, Ms. Luckett. Ms. Tellez is not able to be here as she is in the hospital giving birth. The State opposes any bond modification citing deft's criminal history and the strength of the case.

BTC: bond modification is granted: 15CF746- $1,500.00 cash and in 15CF814-$2,500.00 cash. All terms and conditions as previously ordered remain
From Vanessa Tellez on behalf of defendant.
for review of bail.
